page.title: 20VISITOR'S VIEW
page.content: WE FREQUENTLY RETURN TO NATEBY AND WHARTON, WHERE WE ARE WARMLY WELCOMED BY EVERYONE WE MEET. WHETHER WE APPROACH FROM HAWES, SEDBERGH OR BROUGH, THE SENSATION OF BEING A PART OF THIS SMALL COMMUNITY IS ALWAYS PRESENT; A COMMUNITY WHOSE HOMES NESTLE IN THE FOLDS OF CURVING LIME- STONE HILLS. UNKNOWN TO MOST PEOPLE, BYPASSED BY MANY, NATEBY AND WHARTON PROVIDE FOR US A HAVEN OF PASTORAL QUIET AND BEAUTY DIFFICULT TO MATCH. HERE, THE HILLS DO 'GIRD OUR DWELLINGS ROUND', AND BEYOND THEM, THE FELLS INVITE ONE TO VENTURE FORTH ON FOOT. OUR REWARD, AS WE CLIMB TO THE HEIGHTS IS THE MUSIC OF TUMBLING WATER IN THE BECKS AND GILLS, THE BLEAT OF EWE AND LAMB, AND THE VIEW OF DISTANT MOUNTAIN CARESSED BY FLEECY CLOUD.
